Description.Name: Sample hardware abstraction for WF-M620-RSC1
MainCoreHeaderFileTopContent: /* Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
// This file defines the mapping from the MT3620 reference development board (RDB) to the
// 'sample hardware' abstraction used by the samples at https://github.com/Azure/azure-sphere-samples.
// Some peripherals are on-board on the RDB, while other peripherals must be attached externally if needed.
// See TODO(85663) for more information on how to use hardware abstractions
// to enable apps to work across multiple hardware variants.

Peripherals.Name: BOARD_UART
Peripherals.Comment: AILINK WF-M620-RSC1: WF-M620-RSC1 ISU 1 configured as UART, pin 15 (RX), pin 14 (TX), pin 11 (CTS), pin 10 (RTS).

Peripherals.Name: BOARD_I2C
Peripherals.Comment: AILINK WF-M620-RSC1: WF-M620-RSC1 ISU 0 configured as I2C,  pin 68 (SDA) and pin 67 (SCL).

Peripherals.Name: BOARD_SPI
Peripherals.Comment: AILINK WF-M620-RSC1: WF-M620-RSC1 ISU 0 configured as SPI, pin 7 (MISO), pin 5 (SCLK), pin 8 (CSA), pin 6 (MOSI) and pin 9 (CSB)

Peripherals.Name: BOARD_SPI_CS
Peripherals.Comment: MT3620 SPI Chip Select (CS) value "A". This is not a peripheral identifier, and so has no meaning in an app manifest.
